articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: As the Gaza war nears its first anniversary, previously unreported email exchanges between senior Biden administration officials show that Washington was warned early on that Israel might be committing war crimes.
articles.title: Emails show early US concerns over Gaza offensive, risk of Israeli war crimes

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel bombed central Beirut in the early hours of Thursday, killing at least six people, after its forces suffered their deadliest day on the Lebanese front in a year of clashes against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel strikes heart of Beirut, killing six

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul
articles.description: For Sinwar, architect of the Hamas cross-border raids that became the deadliest day in Israel's history, armed struggle remains the only way to force the creation of a Palestinian nation.
articles.title: Yahya Sinwar, Hamas’ hunted leader, remains committed to Israel's destruction

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: The European Commission said on Friday it had received enough support from EU members to impose tariffs of up to 45% on Chinese electric vehicle imports in the bloc's highest profile trade case, but would continue to negotiate with Beijing.
articles.title: EU executive to adopt tariffs on Chinese EVs after vote

articles.author: Bruno Kelly, Jake Spring
articles.description: The river port in the Amazon rainforest's largest city of Manaus on Friday hit its lowest level since 1902, as a drought drains waterways and snarls transport of grain exports and essential supplies that are the region's lifeline.
articles.title: Brazil drought sinks Amazon rainforest port river level to 122-year low

articles.author: Harold Isaac
articles.description: Armed men belonging to the Gran Grif gang killed at least 70 people, including three infants, as they swept through a Haitian town shooting automatic rifles at residents, a spokesperson for the United Nations' Human Rights Office said on Friday.
articles.title: Haitian gang kills at least 70 people, including 3 infants, UN says

articles.author: Eli Berlzon, Michal Yaakov Itzhaki
articles.description: Israeli couple Leron and Zoli Mor have identical tattoos on their arms showing a procession of eight elephants, their tails and trunks intertwined.
articles.title: A year after she was taken hostage, Israeli girl adapts to new family life

articles.author: Aram Roston, Alexandra Ulmer
articles.description: Jared Kushner, son-in-law of former U.S. President Donald Trump, has discussed U.S.-Saudi diplomatic negotiations involving Israel with Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman multiple times since leaving the Trump White House, said a source familiar with the discussions.
articles.title: Exclusive:  Kushner has discussed U.S.-Saudi diplomacy with Saudi crown prince

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: The ruins of a coffee shop in the West Bank city of Tulkarm show the force of the airstrike on Thursday night that killed a senior local commander of the militant group Hamas - and at least 17 others.
articles.title: Deadly Israeli strike in West Bank highlights spread of war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane carrying several dozens of Poles and citizens of other countries who wanted to leave Lebanon landed in Warsaw on Friday, the Polish Foreign Ministry said on social media platform X.
articles.title: Plane carrying Poles from Lebanon lands in Warsaw
